text: Borefts 7th edition day 1 25/09/2016. Aroma is big solvent, alcohol, caramel, brown sugars, paint stripper. Black / caramel brown coloured pour with a fading tan head. Flavour is composed of caramel, smooth roast, warming bourbon, tangy apple, solvent. Palate is velvety smooth, sticky, moderate carbonation. good.
Draft at Fred Fest. AFTW kicked up in intensity. Huge barrel component, lots of smoke, deep rich brown sugar. Smooth and potent. Impressive. Most impressive.

Draught @ 7th Borefts Beer Festival 2015, Brouwerij de Molen, Bodegraven, Netherlands. [ As Hair of the Dog Adam from the Wood - 1978 Heaven Hill Barrel ].Unclear dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, dark malt, sweet malt, dried fruit, alcohol. Flavor is heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, buzzy, alcohol, chocolate, dark malt. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light moderate alcoholic. [20150925]
Tap @ Borefts 15. Notes from then: Wow.. Whisky/oak --> sweet --> whisky/oak again. Roasted hints too. Amazing beer. Lots of whisky. Great, great beer!

Borefts Beer Festival 2015. Cloudy dark brown with a tiny off-white head. Aroma of licorice and chocolate, with oak and bourbon notes and quite a bit of booze. Sweet chocolate and malt flavour with lots of bourbon and a touch of dried fruit.

Had this one at Borefts, from the tap. An excellent beer, with an extremely complex aroma and taste - chocolate, coffee, vanilla, macerated fruits, apples, pears, grapes, cherries, cherry liquor and so on. Super smooth mouthfeel with a heavy bourbon taste that I enjoyed quite a bit.
Borefts 2015, Day two. Tap. Zoet, bourbon overheerst erg maar wel heel lekker. Backlog from 2015/09/26.

On tap at Borefts Beer Festival 2015, day 1. Pours a flat, murky dark brown. Aroma is oily, very boozy, lots of bourbon, coconut, gasoline, burned wood, milk chocolate. Taste is sweet, boozy and has a slight acidity, roasted and very sweet malts, huge caramel. Flat body, no carb. Too much, too strong!
From tap. Pours hazy dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is wooden, acetone and dark toasted malt. Solid alcohol presence. Dark malt. Wooden. Dry and warming finish. Too much.

Geproefd tijdens Borefts 2015 van de tap. Mijn hoge verwachtingen van de bieren van Hair of the Dog, worden gelijk ingelost, wat een smaakbom. Zeer donkerbruine kleur met vrijwel geen schuim, slechts een paar beige belletjes.
Het aroma is zeer rijk en zoet met tonen van; donker en gedroogd fruit als dadels, vijgen en pruimen, vanille, hout en krachtige bourbon tonen van de Heaven Hill barrels. Echt een smaaksensatie, perfect in balans tussen zoet, licht zurig met vele complexe smaken in het pallet, vanille chocolade, maar ook tabak en oude eiken vaten, met een krachtige alcoholische finish van zachte Amerikaanse bourbon. Voor mij echt de topper van de bieren die ik heb mogen proeven tijdens Borefts 2015.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught. Dark brownish coloured. Dense light brown head. ARoma. Ripe fruits, alcohol, spice, wood, vanilla. Flavour . ripe fruits, intense sweetness, vanilla, alcohol, caramel. Medium to full bodied. Ends fruity and sweet with alcohol burn
Looks rather murky and flat. Aroma has lots of Bourbon whiskey and booze. Very silky and smooth. Warming. Lots of vanilla in the aftertaste. Perhaps a bit too boozy but still very nice.

(Hair of the Dog Adam From the Wood - 1978 Heaven Hill Barrel) Tap at Borefts 2015.
Murky brown colour on the body, no head.Ároma has lots of bourbon, alcohol, dark roasted malts, smoke, peat.
Taste has lots of bourbon, lots of vanilla, alcohol, roasted malts, wood. 
Medium thick body, low carbonation, sticky on the palate.
Fantastic beer.

[9/25/15] Draught sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2015 in Bodegraven. Murky brown. Aroma of chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, cookies, caramel, nuts, dark fruits. Sweet flavor with caramel, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, cookies, dark fruits and nuts. Rounded mouthfeel. Great one.

Draught at Borefts Beer Festival 2015. 
Hazy dark brown coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel and dried fruits with notes of alcohol.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel and dried fruits with notes of alcohol.
Warming alcoholic finish.

Keg at BBF 7, Bodegraven, 25/09/15.
Extremely dark mahogany brown with moderate beige spotting. 
Nose is spice, chocolate, toffee, figs, fruit cake, light smoke.
Taste comprises rich malt, spice, chocolate, tobacco, light bourbon trace, figgy jam. 
Full bodied, fine carbonation, drying close with a little boost. 
Solid stuff, good depth, balanced sipper.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
25/IX/15 - on tap @ Borefts 2015 (Bodegraven) - BB: n/a (2015-1262) Thanks to 77ships and the Israeli beer tickers scene for sharing todays beers!
Little cloudy purple brown beer, aery irregular beige frothy head, pretty stable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots and lots of bourbon, vanilla overload, sweet, wow! MF: soft to no carbon, full body. Taste: lots of bourbon, alcohol, caramel, sweet, some strawberry jam, sourish touch. Aftertaste: vanilla, bourbon, alcohol, caramel, sweet finish. Wow! Guilty pleasure much! So dessert! ;)
25th September 2015Borefts VII. Day 1. Opaque dark brown beer, a few pale tan bubbles. Smooth semi dry palate. Sweet bourbon and a little vanilla wood. Nice fruits. Spice. Warming finish. Very nice.

Sampled @ Borefts 2015. Opaque dark brown color, medium sized beige head that lasts for quite a while. Strong boozy aroma, cognac, brown sugar. Taste malts, alcohol, wood, oak, liquor, leather, dark malts, bitter and sweet at the same time. Heavy.
Drank @ Borefts 2015 (friday), my first beer of the festival! Very nice one. Rich taste, incredible. Very complex beer, with a little peat.
Tasted @ Borefts Beer Festival 2015. Very soft and smooth, loads of vanilla and oak. Maybe a little hyped, but still one of the best beers of the festival for me. Lovely.

Tap @ Borefts Beer Festival 2015. Pours greasy black. Aroma is smoky, peaty, burned wood, whisky, chocolate, malt. Taste is peaty, chocolate, vanilla, milk chocolate, black currants, smoke, tobacco, ash. Too smoky to hit anything high for me.

Glass at Borefts, was looking forward to this one. Pours murky brown with tiny head. Aromas and flavor are big on the barrel they used, whiskey fire, figs, chocolate, molasses and sweet malt. Very aggressive and boozy. Lacked any balance.

Οn tap at Borefts 15. Dark brown color with no head. Aromas of vanilla, caramel, bourbon. Taste isvanilla, caramel, bourbon, dark fruits, blackcurrants, simply amazing!! The aftertaste is long and sweet. Full body with none to low carbonation. Amazing!

Tap at Borefts 15. Pours cloudy brown with a medium beige head. Aroma of massive boozy bourbon and woody barrel notes upfront, with vanilla, overripe dark fruits, chocolate and sweet toffee. Flavour is heavy sweet. Full bodied with alcoholic warmth in the palate and soft carbonation. Good and fun to try, but so boozy!

Sampled @ Borefts 15. Pours a murky brown beer with as good as no head on top. Aroma of bourbon and oak, caramel, light chocolate and loads of booze. Flavor is very sweet with loads of booze as well, loads of oak and bourbon. Very full, long sweet finish and a bit off balance, but somehow it suits this beer quite well.

Tap @ borefts beer festival 2015. Pours murky black with no head. Aroma of vanilla, dry wood, dark sweet fruits, chocolate and some dark caramel malts. The taste has some dark chocolate, some vanilla, some wood, caramel and some weak tobacco note as well. A bit all over the place for me (unbalanced). Still quite good.

sample from draft at borefts 15. its great to see that allan is bringing some of his exclusive beers to a dutch festival. i was really pomped to try this one! not the best looking beer. poured a real murky brown colour with a non to long lasting tanned head. nose is instantly hit with a huge amount of sweet sticky bourbon, a lot of fruit esters, cherries, and dark fruits. currants, and prunes. fairly ashy, and a note of tobacco. charred oak, vanilla, raisins, and a very good noticeable alcohol level in the taste. the barrel notice is huge on this one. one of the best beers during the festival. incredible stuff!

@Borefts 2015, dag 2 van tap, wou deze dag beginnen met een licht biertje... verkeerde genomen van de tap... was dus gelijk met beide benen weer op de grond na dag 1... donker bruin en nagenoeg kraagloos. aroma van zoete bourbon, graan, erg alcoholisch, vanille, maar gewoon erg lekkere bourbon man... smaken zijn zoet, alcohol, mooie zachte zoete complexe bourbon van de heaven hill, lijkt wel wat op een barley wine, maar zeg wat een heerlijke smaken in dit bier zeg... erg smooth, lekker over barrel aged van de bourbon, gelukkig vind ik dat héérlijk...

Tap @ Borefts 2015. Deep copper color. Malt, roast, toffee, bourbon and vanilla ain the amazingly complex aroma. Very low on carbon. Strong malty sweet flavor with bourbon, vanilla and oak. Caramel. Toffee, Alcoholic. Velvety mouthfeel. Brilliant!

Tap @ Borefts 15, small sample. Slight hazy copper color, short head. Aroma is quite boozy, some caramel and molasses, bourbon, oak wood, slight vanilla. Quite sharpish alcoholic taste, bit thin caramel sweetness. Barrel is quite overwhelming and balance is lost a bit. I expected more to be honest.

On tap at Borefts 2015. Clear, dark reddish brown with a creamy tan head. Sweetish-boozy, fruity aroma of prunes, molasses, peat, caramel, vanilla, cherries, licorice. Sweetish-malty, boozy taste, licorice, peat, vanille, tar, whiskey. Long, boozy, finish. Full body, oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very intense, quite boozy, lots of peat and whiskey, but good.

Thx! for sharing. Sampled draft @ Borefts 2015. Day 1. Very dark brown, almost no head. Just a few bubbles. Nose is very boozy, close to being too much, warming with a very thick sugary, syrupy malts, molasses, rich, decadent. Taste is warming alcohol with rich whiskey followed by very thick, syrupy, molasses, malts, warming, malts, sugar, thick syrup, dates, dark fruit, Pretty much, thick warming molasses body. Had it once again on Day 2. Awesome, only small minus is probably that it is a touch too hot. Maybe some age might resolve it, Adam from the Wood is a touch better only due to this aspect but overall really amazing still.
At Borefts 2015. Divine aroma of rich vanilla and chocolate. Thick flavor of vanilla, chocolate, raisin, caramel and ripe fruit. Long finish. This is awesome.

On tap at Borefts 2015. Dark brown with very little head. Aroma is mixed dried dark fruits, toasted wood, peated whiskey, smoke, cherry brandy, dates. Full bodied, sticky mouthfeel, rich and complex on the palate with a long fruity and boozy finish. Taste is dried cherries, raisins, dark chocolate, dried apricot, cherry brandy, smoke, Christmas cake, brandy.
Intensiver, deutlich süßer und alkoholischer Antrunk. Weich, dennoch unsüffig, geringfügig bitter. Brennend alkoholischer Nachhall. 11/11/8/9//9
Trübes dunkel orange braunes Bier mit einer mittelgroßen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv malzig, reifes Obst, alkoholisch, Holz. Geschmack intensiv nach Vanille, Holz, Karamell, alkoholisch.
My favourite of this festival. The first one to start with, and enjoyd it a lot. The wood, malts and liquourish taste made it yummie for sure.
drank at Borefts 2015. Pours dark, not much head. Smell is pure bourbon. Taste is intense,sharp,grainy bourbon. Back of sweet malts. Nice, but boozy and not as balanced as the regular version.

On tap at Borefts 15. Dark brown, beige head. Aroma of whisky, booze, dark fruits, vanilla, pipe tobacco, wood, light earthy. Flavour is sweet, filthily rich, dark fruits, very malty, lots of whisky, vanilla, wood, very very nice. Full bodied. Perfect score for flavour here.
Big complex sweet tasty beer. Some vanilla in aroma, some sweetness. Nice complexity. Just a very good well made beer.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2015 From tap at Borefts 15. Aroma of malt, lots of vanilla, wood, cognac, bourbon, booze. Flavour is massively sweet. Medium to heavy body. Very smooth and powerful, but rather boozy.

Tap at Borefts. Black with some big off white bubbles. Massive bourbon, vanilla, old wood, boozy with some grappa and rum but mainly lots of old bourbon. Light chocolate underneath. Sweet with light alcoholic bitterness. Medium bodied with slick feel and very light carbonation. Bourbon bomb.
On tap Borefts 2015. Very dark brown colour lasting beige head. Hot and boozy barrel ageing comes through. Hot alcohol. Interesting but boozy.
@ borefts 15. Black colour with a small medium brown head. Smells appelstroop mostly, sweet, bourbon. Tastes appelstroop, sweet, bourbon. Thick body, soft carbo.
Zwarte rode kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig, drop, koffie. Smaakt vol, vanille, drop zoetig.
Donker rood bier met een goede beige schuim kraag. Ruikt overrijp fruit, vanille. Smaakt ook zo. Knetter zoet.
@Boreft2015. Een heerlijke BA heaven hill, vol van smaak en geur, mooie bourbon smaak. Topper!

Keg at Borefts Beer Festival, De Molen, Bodegraven Friday 25th September 2015.   Dark murky colour with a light beige rim, thick in mouth, boozy, chewy booziness comes back down your nose. Aroma is Pedro Ximinez. Taste is liquidised, crystallised dates. I thought that I was going to love it and I bet this is raved about but meh...not that fussed, ok. A7 A3 T6 P3 Ov13 3.2
Tap at Borefts 2015 dark black.. Thin tan lacing... Dark roast... Oxidised soya roast malts nose.. Dark roast big barrel.. Dark roast.. Massive whisky... Rich complx intense
Keg at borefts. Pours deep brown, nose is massive bourbon, toffee, vanilla, caramel, taste is rich, bourbon, wood, hot and boozy.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a cloudy dark brown color with a small almost no head. A big sweet huge bourbon nose. Vanilla, figs, leather. The flavor is more huge whiskey, vanilla, oxidation, dark fruit. Massive amounts of bourbon. Sour mash. The barrel is just huge but aged enough to be drinkable. Very different than regular aftw.

Tap.

A: Dark creme head, cloudy, dirty brown body, legs.

N: Enormous bourbon laced with vanilla, caramel, coconut, some toffee, leather, tobacco, cocoa. Fig and raisin, some cherry. Touch of smoke.

T: Luxurious sweetness. Smoke and spice.

M: Medium body, soft carbonation, noticeable alcohol presence.

O: Damn good. One of the best Bourbon Adams I have had.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2015 On tap at HOTD. This was a beer released the day after Fred Eckhardt passed away. It is an Adam aged in whisky barrels that were from 1978.
Colour...very dark brown with no head. Nose...massive dark fruits teeming with huge amounts of dark cherries, medjool dates, Zante currents, Italian prunes and loads of boozy goodness. Palate...tangy, tart, sweet and oaky with unctuous gobs of oaky/boozy splendour. The mid palate keeps the oak going and adds tobacco as well. The finish is ultra long and resounds with whisky and steeped fruit. Extraordinary stuff!
